questionText: What are some big mysteries about space that scientists are still trying to figure out?
How do the Sun, Moon, and Earth work together to create day, night, and the seasons?
What would happen if the Earth were closer or farther from the Sun?
What does studying other planets teach us about our own place in the Solar System?
How does the Sun’s gravity keep planets in orbit, and how do we see this force on Earth?
What are asteroids and comets, and how do they affect our Solar System?
How do telescopes help scientists explore space, and what have they helped us discover?
How do black holes form?
What do you think would happen to a human approaching a place hole? What do you think would happen if Earth was pulled into a black hole?
How does gravity shape galaxies and keep them together?
What are the different types of galaxies, and which one is the Milky Way?
If you could explore any part of space, where would you go and why?
How do stars, planets, and black holes interact in space?
What roles do gravity play in galaxies?
What happens when two galaxies collide?
Why is exploring space important, and what are some things we have learned from it?
Have you heard of Newton's Laws? If so what are they?
What are some challenges of living and working in space?
How do telescopes, satellites, and space probes help scientists study the universe?
What would happen if we didn’t have satellites?
What are some dangers of space travel, and how do astronauts stay safe?
What are some benefits of humans exploring space? What are some consequences?
What is the International Space Station, and why is it important?
How has space exploration changed over time, and what do you think the future of space travel will look like?
What are some ways studying space can help us solve problems on Earth?
What kinds of jobs do people have in space exploration besides being astronauts?
If humans want to visit another planet, what challenges would they face?
What are some things we still don’t understand about the universe?
How do scientists know dark matter and dark energy exist if they can’t see them?
Why do scientists think the universe is expanding? What do you think might happen in the future?
What do you think the biggest discovery in space will be in the next 50 years?
Why is it important to study astronomy? What do we gain from exploring space?
